required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics With Two New Oral Nicotine Replacement Products and Nicorette® Gum
clinical_study.official_title: Single-dose Pharmacokinetics With Two New Oral Nicotine Replacement Products and Nicorette® Gum. A Study in Healthy Smokers.
clinical_study.source: Johnson & Johnson Consumer and Personal Products Worldwide

brief_summary.textblock: Single-dose pharmacokinetics with two new oral nicotine replacement products and Nicorette® gum.

detailed_description.textblock: The study is a single-dose, randomized, cross-over study. The investigational products will be given as single doses at separate visits. The product administrations comprise 30 minutes of chewing. Periods without NRT, lasting for at least 36 hours, will separate treatment visits. Before and after the start of product administration at each treatment visit, blood will be sampled for pharmacokinetic analyses, pre-dose, and during 8 hours after start of product administration. Used gums will be collected and analyzed to determine the amount of remaining nicotine. Subjects will also be monitored to capture any adverse events that may occur. Treatment labels will be concealed from subjects and study personnel.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and during 8 hours after product administration
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic measurements including: the maximum observed nicotine concentration in plasma (Cmax) the area under the plasma concentration-vs.-time curve until the last measurable concentration (AUCt) the area under the plasma concentration-vs.-time curve until infinity (AUC∞)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 8 hours after start of product administration
secondary_outcome.description: The time of occurrence of Cmax following product administration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 8 hours after start of product administration
secondary_outcome.description: The terminal nicotine elimination rate constant (λz)
The amount of nicotine released from gums during 30 minutes' chewing.

intervention.other_name: Experimental NRT UNG-GA and UNG-GB, and Nicorette® Gum

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy subjects, smoking at least 10 cigarettes daily during at least one year preceding inclusion and BMI between 17.5 and 30.0 kg/m2.
- Female participants of child-bearing potential are required to use a medically acceptable means of birth control.
- A personally signed and dated informed consent document, indicating that the subject has been informed of all pertinent aspects of the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy, lactation or intended pregnancy.
- Treatment with an investigational product or donation or loss of blood within 3 month preceding the first dose of study medication.
